intro.p: In their winning bid to host the 2028 Summer Olympics, Los Angeles leaders pledged that the city’s version of the Games would be the greenest ever — a goal they plan to achieve in large part by making access to the event “car-free.” To do so, the LA Metro needs to extend rail lines, add many, many buses and clear countless traffic lanes to allow hundreds of thousands of people to navigate a metropolis that sprawls across 4,000 square miles.

In preparation, the Los Angeles Department of Transportation sent a survey to randomly selected print newspaper subscribers who live in Los Angeles County. Survey respondents completed the survey online.

Survey respondents were asked to decide to what degree they agreed with the following statements. The possible answers were "Strongly Agree", "Agree", "Neither Agree or Disagree", "Disagree", "Strongly Disagree".

item.p: The Olympics will be the most incredible, joyful experience to bring the Los Angeles community together so the Department of Transportation should ban all individual cars from the downtown area beginning a full month before the Olympics begins. Businesses should be forced to allow their employees to work remotely to accommodate this ban.

The entire world will be looking at Los Angeles. If the city doesn’t clean up the disgusting, trash-filled streets by greatly reducing cars and forcing people to stay away from downtown unless they are attending the games, the world will think the city is a failure and a horrible place to be.
